citation.article-title: Hahella chejuensis gen. nov., sp. nov., an extracellular-polysaccharide-producing marine bacterium.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Hahella (Ha.hel'la. M.L. fem. n., named after Yung Chil Hah, a Korean bacteriologist who pioneered microbiological research in Korea)
Cells are Gram-negative, facultatively anaerobic, rod-shaped and motile by means of a single polar flagellum.
The organism uses several carbohydrates as carbon sources and produces acid from sugars.
The organism is unable to grow in the absence of NaCl.
Detailed properties are given in Tables 1 and 2.
Phylogenetically, the genus belongs to the c subclass of the Proteobacteria.
The DNA G+C content of the type species is 55 mol%.
The type and only species of the genus is Hahella chejuensis.
